results.title: The Guns of Navarone
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Open Road Films, Cecil F. Ford and J Thompson
results.brief_description: The suspense builds and the drama explodes in J. Lee Thompson’s finely crafted adaptation of Alistair MacLean’s best-selling novel. Gregory Peck, Anthony Quinn, David Niven, and Anthony Quayle are allied saboteurs, assigned an impossible mission - infiltrate an impregnable Nazi-held island and destroy two enormous long-range field guns that prevent the rescue of 2000 trapped British soldiers. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations, receiving the Oscar for Best Special Effects, this film is still regarded as one of the greatest action-adventure spectacles ever produced.

results.title: The Grifters
results.creator_credit: Cineplex Odeon Films, Martin Scorsese, Robert A. Harris, Jim Painten and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Set in the sleazy horse-tracks and gambling dens of contemporary L.A., “The Grifters” is a modern crime film that compares favourably to classic Hollywood film-noir films. Based on Jim Thompson’s pulp classic of the same name, this film shimmers with a consistent erotic tension. John Cusack is Roy, a young con-man who makes easy money off the gullible hordes that crowd Los Angeles. He finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous tug-of-war between his prostitute girlfriend (Annette Bening) who wants him to committ a major scam, and his elegant but desperate mother, Lily (Angelica Huston), who has been hustling for years and wants to find a way out. Both are powerful women not adverse to using the people they love to get what they want, and their desperate machinations to achieve financial independance puts Roy’s very life at risk. This brilliantly directed film is a powerful study on the corrosive effects of power and money on human relationships. All the cast is outstanding but special mention must be made of the majestic Angelica Huston: her blazing and frightening performance as Lily is unforgettable.

results.title: The Green berets (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Batjac Productions, Warner Bros Pictures, Seven Arts, Michael Wayne, John Wayne and Ray Kellogg
results.brief_description: After extensive training, Colonel Michael Kirby selects two platoons from the U.S. Special forces - known as the Green Berets - for guerilla warfare at Anang. The soldiers are needed to widen the ‘killing zone’ around a Strike Camp in Viet Cong Territory. One of the most controversial movies about the Vietnamese Conflict, ‘Green berets’ stars John Wayne and David Janssen.

results.title: The Greatest story ever told
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and George Stevens
results.brief_description: With one of the finest film casts ever assembled, this epic has been hailed as the definitive screen version of the life and times of Jesus Christ. As Jesus, the internationally acclaimed Max Von Sydow reveals the compassion, anguish and glory of the “King of the Jews” in the performance of a lifetime. The distinguished ensemble cast also features Charlton Heston as John the Baptist, Jose Ferrer as King Herrod, John Wayne as the Centurion, Sidney Poitier as Simon of Cyrene, Telly Savalas as Pontius Pilate and Angela Lansbury as Claudia. Combining stellar performances, lavish sets, stunning locations and costing in excess of $20 million dollars, the story is true to the pages of the Gospel, earning five Academy Award nominations to become an enduring and revered classic.

results.title: The Greatest show on Earth
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Cecil B. DeMille blended drama with spectacle, using the Ringling Bros. Barnum & Bailey Circus as a backdrop. The film is a behind-the- scenes look at the triumphs and conflicts of circus performers. The magic and thrill of life under the Big Top is stunningly recreated. The all-star cast includes Betty Hutton, Cornel Wilde, Charlton Heston, Dorothy Lamour and James Stewart as “Buttons the Clown”. Filled with romance, intrigue and high-flying acrobatics, “The Greatest Show on Earth” is exactly that.

results.title: The Great Waltz
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Bernard H. Hyman and Julien Duvivier
results.brief_description: This film captures the spirit of a romantic age when Johann Strauss created some of the world’s favourite melodies. French actor Fernand Gravet plays Strauss with Luise Rainer as his wife Poldi. Soprano Miliza Korjus plays Carla Donner, the opera singer with whom Strauss was infatuated and for whom he wrote some of his greatest works including “Die Fledermaus”

results.title: The Great Muppet caper
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment, David Lazer, Frank Oz and Jim Henson
results.brief_description: Kermit and Fozzie Bear star as twin reporters, who together with the rest of the Muppet gang travel to Great Britain in search of jewel thieves. Catching the guilty culprits seems to be the only action to redeem themselves with their boss for letting the thieves escape under their very noses. During their stay Kermit meets Miss Piggy posing as fashion designer Lady Holiday (Diana Rigg), the woman whose gems have been stolen. While the Muppets are in Britain another of Lady Holiday’s diamonds is stolen and Miss Piggy is arrested on suspicion of theft. Now there is even more at stake than their jobs as the Muppets race to clear Miss Piggy’s name and stop another theft from occurring. Features cameos by Peter Falk, John Cleese, Peter Ustinov and others.

results.title: The Great mouse detective
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Burny Mattinson, Ron Clements, David Michener and John Musker
results.brief_description: Early computer animated Disney feature, features the mellifluous tones of Vincent Price as Professor Rattigan, a Sherlock Homes type character who is a master of mystery sleuthing. Set in Victoria London, England Rattigan (a highly intelligent scientific mouse) is joined by various cohorts on the trail of the abducted father of a little mouse. An entertaining effort directed at children, that charms in many ways with its gentle humour and fun characterisations.

results.title: The Great Gatsby
results.creator_credit: Newdorn Company, Paramount Pictures, David Merrick and Jack Clayton
results.brief_description: F. Scott Fitzgerald’s masterpiece is a story that could only have taken place in the Jazz Age: an era in which recklessness with money, liquor, women and fast cars pervaded the American consciousness. Robert Redford is Jay Gatsby, the dashing, enigmatic millionaire obsessed with the elusive and spoiled Daisy Buchanan (Mia Farrow). The screenplay for this elegant story was conceived with a meticulous concern for language, time and place by Francis Ford Coppola. Cast also includes Karen Black, Scott Wilson, Sam Waterson, Lois Chiles, Bruce Dern, Howard da Silva, Patsy Kensit.
